title: Salesforce Plus Slack Doesn’t Equal Microsoft
sub_head: Deal-weary Salesforce investors may need to brace for more acquisitions
body:
Salesforce.com has never been one for thinking small, but buying Slack Technologies stretches the company’s ambitions to a whole new level.
Salesforce formally announced the $27.7 billion deal Tuesday afternoon, confirming a report by the Wall Street Journal last week that the two were talking. The mostly cash offer values Slack at about $45.50 a share, which is a 54% premium to its unaffected price and represents a multiple of about 26 times forward sales. As such, Slack is Salesforce’s most expensive deal by multiple measures....
